Function.Description: The nsub function returns the difference all of its arguments.

Brief.Overview: The nsub is a built-in function that returns the difference all of its arguments starting from the leftmost arguments and returns the result as a Number quantity. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: The nsub built-in function is a simple, but very fast numeric subtraction function that assumes all of its arguments are type Number. Use the nsub function for highly optimized numeric subtraction. For a slower, but more general subtraction, that performs type conversion, use the subtraction operator, -, (minus sign).

Syntax.Return: The difference all of its arguments starting from the leftmost arguments expressed as a Number.
